title: 113_hr3025
content: The Act titled "Irene and Lee Tax Relief Storm Recovery Act of 2013" allows for additional low-income housing credit allocation in states affected by Hurricane Irene or Tropical Storm Lee in 2011. The "Irene and Lee Tax Relief Storm Recovery Act of 2013" increases the State housing credit ceiling for states affected by Hurricane Irene or Tropical Storm Lee in 2011 for calendar years 2013, 2014, and 2015. The State housing credit agency allocates a dollar amount for buildings in a disaster area, with an applicable limitation based on population or 50% of the State. The State housing credit agency allocates a dollar amount for buildings in a disaster area, with an applicable limitation based on population or 50% of the State. Allocations are prioritized from the additional allocation amount for determining carryover, and there are provisions for difficult development areas. "In 2013, 2014, or 2015, the Irene-Lee disaster area is designated as a difficult development area for property placed in service, affecting the housing credit dollar amounts allocated." "In 2013, 2014, or 2015, dollar amounts allocated for property placed in service in the Irene-Lee disaster area are affected, with special rules for income tests applying to property placed in service after 2012 and before 2020 in a nonmetropolitan area within the disaster area." "In the Irene-Lee disaster area, special rules apply for low-income housing credit allocations made in 2013, 2014, or 2015, with buildings needing to be placed in service before January 1, 2019." The term 'Irene-Lee disaster area' refers to counties affected by a natural disaster declaration in 2011, including contiguous counties. In 2011, the Secretary of Agriculture designated areas affected by Hurricane Irene or Tropical Storm Lee as disaster areas under specific acts. The amendment made by this section will be effective on the date of the enactment of this Act.
